    • Method Detail

      • parseCommandLine

        public CallArguments parseCommandLine(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method will parse the raw command line arguments expressed in an expected JSON format into value objects for processing by the application.
        Specified by:
        parseCommandLine in interface CommandLineParser
        Parameters:
        args - The raw command line parameters. This parser expects command lines of the form: -problems "" or -problemsFile . For the former, the JSON string entered on the command line should be quoted to allow for any whitespace. Property names do not need to be quoted. The json contains the information for the solvers to operate. It is in the form of an array of objects with a problemId property which corresponds to the Project Euler problem id to solve and an array of arguments named "args" which will be parsed into the fields of the appropriate ProblemParameters implementation according to the documentation on its ProblemParameters.populate(java.lang.String[]) method. See src/main/resources/SampleProblemsFile.txt for an example of a valid problems file to invoke solving problems 8, 9 and 10. Example command line: -problems "[{problemId:10,args:[1000]}]"
        Returns:
        CallArguments a container value object holding the parsed command line arguments.
        Throws:
        CommandLineParseException - if there is an issue with parsing the command line arguments, either they are malformed or the 'problemsFile' is not accessible.
